title: Is Broadcom Stock a Buy?
description: Broadcom is well-positioned to benefit from the AI infrastructure buildout through its networking portfolio and custom chip development for AI workloads. While its non-AI semiconductor businesses have struggled, a recovery in these areas and continued growth in AI-related revenue could make Broadcom a solid investment option.

title: Dividends Are Never a Guarantee. These 3 Stocks Made Massive Cuts to Their Payouts This Year
description: Three companies - Estée Lauder, Medical Properties Trust, and Intel - made significant cuts to their dividends this year due to challenging economic conditions, problematic tenants, and the need to invest in their businesses.

title: Narrowband IoT Chipsets Business Research Report 2024: Global Market to Expand by $22 Billion by 2030, Driven by Rising Demand for Low-Power Wide-Area Networks (LPWAN) in IoT Applications
description: The global market for Narrowband IoT Chipsets is projected to reach $24.6 Billion by 2030, driven by the increasing adoption of IoT devices, smart city projects, and the growing demand for low-power, wide-area networks.

title: 3D Semiconductor Packaging Market Size to Achieve USD 57.19 Bn by 2034
description: The global 3D semiconductor packaging market is projected to grow at a CAGR of 16.17% between 2024 and 2034, driven by the increasing demand for advanced packaging solutions and the need for high-performance computing.

title: These Are the 5 Worst-Performing Stocks in the Nasdaq-100 With 2024 Almost Over
description: The article discusses the worst-performing stocks in the Nasdaq-100 index so far in 2022, emphasizing that investors should not abandon long-term investments due to short-term slumps. It suggests considering the underlying reasons for the price declines and maintaining a long-term perspective.

title: Why Intel Stock Popped on Monday
description: Intel is set to receive $8 billion in government subsidies to expand its semiconductor chip operations, but this is not enough to cover even one year of the company's cash needs at its current burn rate. Intel has racked up $16 billion in losses over the last 12 months and is expected to continue burning cash for the next few years, with debt piling up and potential share dilution on the horizon.

title: High Performance Computing Market to Drive Growth at USD 3.87 Billion by 2031
description: The high-performance computing market is expected to grow at a CAGR of 10.7% from 2024 to 2031, driven by increasing demand for virtualization, IT industry expansion, and the rising adoption of hybrid HPC solutions. The market is dominated by the hardware segment, with advancements in processors, memory, and interconnects enabling HPC systems to perform complex calculations.

title: Will Nvidia Reach $4 Trillion? 3 Reasons It Could Happen by the End of the Year.
description: Nvidia reported strong Q3 earnings, with revenue jumping 94% and adjusted EPS more than doubling. The company is seeing staggering demand for its new Blackwell platform, though supply constraints remain. Wall Street is overwhelmingly bullish on Nvidia, and the stock could reach a $4 trillion market cap soon.

title: Intel Is Prepping a Monster Server CPU for 2025
description: Intel is developing a new server CPU family called Clearwater Forest, which will use its advanced 18A manufacturing process. Clearwater Forest could help Intel regain its competitive edge in the server CPU market against AMD and Arm-based chips, and also boost its foundry business.

title: Should You Buy Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Stock Before Jan. 20?
description: The article discusses how the 2024 U.S. election could impact Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSMC), the world's largest and most advanced semiconductor producer. While the incoming administration may push for more domestic manufacturing, TSMC's dominance and the realities of fab construction mean the U.S. will likely continue to rely on imports. The article also analyzes TSMC's financial performance and valuation compared to its major customers.

title: Applied Materials Announces New Collaboration Model for Advanced Packaging at Summit on Energy-Efficient Computing
description: Applied Materials announced plans to expand its global EPIC innovation platform with a new collaboration model to accelerate commercialization of advanced chip packaging technologies. The company convened top semiconductor R&D leaders to encourage alliances and drive progress in energy-efficient computing.

title: Why Did Nvidia, Intel, Applied Materials, ASML and Lam Research Drop on Friday?
description: Semiconductor stocks like Nvidia, Intel, Applied Materials, and Lam Research dropped on Friday. The article discusses whether this presents a buying opportunity.

title: Will Nvidia Be a $5 Trillion Stock by 2028?
description: Nvidia's pricing power and market share of AI chips could help it sustain impressive earnings growth and reach a $5 trillion valuation. However, the article also mentions that Nvidia's dominance in the AI chip market could face a potential threat, though it is not discussed in detail.
keywords: Nvidia,AI chips,pricing power,market share,earnings growth,$5 trillion valuation

title: The Future of AI PC: Market Segmentation, Growth Projections, Opportunities and Forecast to 2030
description: The AI PC market is projected to grow from $50.61 billion in 2024 to $231.30 billion by 2030, driven by the integration of high-processing NPUs and growing demand for AI-based gaming PCs. Asia Pacific is expected to see the highest CAGR, while desktops/notebooks and Windows OS are expected to dominate the market.
keywords: AI PC market,NPUs,AI-based gaming PCs,Asia Pacific,desktops/notebooks,Windows OS

title: Why Intel Stock Is Jumping Today
description: Intel stock is gaining as leaders in four states push for the dispersal of CHIPS Act funding to Intel before the new administration takes office. There are concerns that Intel may not receive the outlined funding under the Trump administration, but the article suggests it is unlikely the change in administration will materially impact the funding Intel receives.

title: Think Arm Holdings Is Too Expensive? The Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock Has a Trick Up Its Sleeve.
description: Arm Holdings, a semiconductor company, has seen its stock price triple since its IPO in 2023. Despite its high valuation, the company's growth is driven by its power-efficient CPU architecture, which allows it to maintain wide operating margins and grow even in slow-growth markets.

title: Enhanced screen and 5G make the 33mk4 the most versatile 2-in-1 TOUGHBOOK yet
description: The Panasonic TOUGHBOOK 33mk4 2-in-1 detachable tablet features 5G connectivity, increased processing power, and a larger 12-inch screen with a 3:2 aspect ratio, providing enhanced productivity and versatility for mobile workers across various industries.

description: The global embedded computing market is expected to grow at a CAGR of 6.5% from 2024 to 2031, reaching $174.38 billion. title: This Top Dividend Stock Expects This Staggering $100 Trillion Investment Supercycle to Power Robust Growth for Years to Come
description: Brookfield Infrastructure expects robust growth driven by a $100 trillion global infrastructure investment supercycle, fueled by the rising demand for digital infrastructure and decarbonization. title: 3 Ways Stock-Split Stocks Nvidia and Sherwin-Williams Are Modernizing the Dow Jones Industrial Average
description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average is undergoing changes, with Nvidia replacing Intel and Sherwin-Williams replacing Dow Inc. These changes are modernizing the index, making it more tech-focused and representative of the materials sector.

description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average is undergoing changes, with Nvidia replacing Intel and Sherwin-Williams replacing Dow. title: Artificial Intelligence Market Size Projected to Hit USD 3,680.47 Bn by 2034
description: The global artificial intelligence market is expected to grow from $638.23 billion in 2024 to $3,680.47 billion by 2034, driven by advancements in technology, increasing data availability, and growing demand for automation across industries.

title: Edge Ai Software Market Size to Surpass USD 13.12 Billion by 2032 | Straits Research
description: The global edge AI software market is projected to grow from $1.57 billion in 2024 to $13.12 billion by 2032, driven by advancements in energy-efficient AI chips and the growing demand for edge AI in cybersecurity and threat detection. North America and Europe are expected to lead the market, with the US and Europe investing heavily in edge AI solutions.

title: Nvidia Is Joining the Dow Jones Industrial Average. Will This "Magnificent Seven" Stock Be Next?
description: Nvidia is set to join the Dow Jones Industrial Average, replacing Intel. The article discusses the potential for other tech giants like Alphabet to be added to the index in the future.

title: Nvidia Blows Past Apple To Become World's Most Valuable Company
description: Nvidia has surpassed Apple to become the world's most valuable publicly traded company, with a market capitalization of $3.43 trillion. Nvidia's dominance in the artificial intelligence chip market has fueled its exponential growth of over 200% in the past year.

title: 3 Reasons Buying This Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock Is a Risk... And How It Could Pay Off
description: Nvidia's leadership in AI chips makes it a significant player, but its high valuation and strong competition pose risks. However, its massive profits could power game-changing product research, making it a potential growth opportunity for investors.

title: Intel Was Just Dropped From the Dow. History Says This Is What Will Happens Next.
description: Intel's stock popped after reporting Q3 results, but the celebration was short-lived as S&P Global announced that rival Nvidia would replace Intel in the Dow Jones Industrial Average. The move aims to give the index better representation of the semiconductor industry.

title: What Nvidia and Intel Stock Investors Should Know About the Major Dow Jones Index Changes
description: The article discusses the recent updates to the Dow Jones index and how it may impact Nvidia and Intel stock investors. It highlights the changes and their potential implications for these companies.

title: Is Intel Back? 3 Reasons to Take Intel's Turnaround Seriously.
description: Intel, a semiconductor company, has faced challenges this year, with its stock down over 50%. However, its recent Q3 results and other news indicate a potential turnaround. The company has launched new products, seen improvements in its data center business, and made progress on its 18A node technology, which is expected to surpass TSMC's capabilities.

title: Why Intel Stock Was Slipping Today
description: Intel was removed from the Dow Jones Industrial Average and replaced by Nvidia, signaling Intel's waning relevance in the chip sector. Intel's removal will lead to increased supply and less demand for its stock, but the company still has potential if it can execute on its rebuilding plan.

title: Don't Count Intel Out Yet: Why Now Could Be the Best Time to Buy
description: The article discusses the recent updates regarding Intel and Nvidia, with Nvidia replacing Intel in the Dow Jones Industrial Average. The author remains bullish on Intel despite this change.

title: Nvidia Is Joining the Dow Jones Industrial Average This Week. Time to Buy?
description: Nvidia has become a dominant player in the high-growth artificial intelligence market, leading to its stock soaring 173% so far this year. The company's strong earnings and wide margins have led to its inclusion in the Dow Jones Industrial Average, replacing Intel. While Nvidia's entry into the index may not have a huge immediate impact, the company's long-term growth prospects make it an attractive investment.

title: Will the Fed Deliver a 25 bps Cut Next Thursday?
description: The article discusses the high probability of a 25 basis point rate cut by the Federal Reserve at its next meeting, based on market expectations and recent economic data. It also analyzes the impact of the inverted yield curve on the financial sector and the potential for the Fed to normalize the yield curve by the end of 2024.

title: Nvidia Stock Is Joining the Dow Jones Industrial Average Stock Index and Intel Is Being Booted
description: Nvidia is replacing Intel in the Dow Jones Industrial Average, reflecting Nvidia's larger market cap and greater representation of the current U.S. tech environment. This move is expected to increase demand for Nvidia stock as index funds adjust their portfolios.

title: Why Intel Stock Jumped Today
description: Intel's Q3 earnings beat Wall Street's expectations after accounting for one-time impairment charges. The company's Q4 guidance was also better than anticipated, though Intel remains in the early stages of a complicated turnaround effort.

title: Intel Q3 Earnings: What to Expect From the Stock in 2025
description: Intel's Q3 earnings report showed mixed results, with revenue beating estimates but the company facing challenges like declining Altera revenue and heavy investments. Intel plans to restructure and make its foundry business an independent subsidiary, which could benefit shareholders. The company's access to CHIPS Act funding has been delayed, but a potential Trump presidency could help Intel long-term.

title: Why Intel Stock Surged After Earnings
description: The article discusses Intel's (INTC) third-quarter earnings report, providing an overview of the company's performance and inviting readers to subscribe to The Motley Fool's premium services for more in-depth analysis and investment recommendations.

title: Nanosensor Market to surpass USD 1.45 billion by 2032, Says Global Market Insights inc.
description: The nanosensor market is expected to grow significantly, driven by advancements in nanotechnology research and increasing adoption across various industries, including healthcare, environmental monitoring, and manufacturing.

title: TSMC Just Scored a Big Win: Time to Buy the AI Stock?
description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSMC) is the world's largest contract chip manufacturer, with a dominant market share. Its new Arizona plant is outperforming its Taiwan facilities, helping TSMC unlock government grants and loans while delivering strong margins. This diversification strategy puts TSMC ahead of rivals like Samsung and Intel, positioning it to lead the chip foundry industry.
